definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership

sentences.english: For example, an electronic book for $30 could be sold to your prospects.
sentences.chinese: 例如，电子书籍可以出售给你30元的前景。

sentences.english: We studied many lawbooks and he knows what I would say.
sentences.chinese: 我们研究了许多法律书籍，所以他知道我的意见。

sentences.english: Shanghai, a lot of Spanish books in bookstores.
sentences.chinese: 上海的书店有很多西班牙语的书籍。

sentences.english: And then you come across this joyful book.
sentences.chinese: 然后你选择转看令人开心的书籍。

sentences.english: For example, books have authors and publishers.
sentences.chinese: 例如，书籍都有作者和出版商。

sentences.english: They all curate exhibitions, publish books and catalogs , and organize conferences and symposia.
sentences.chinese: 他们策划展览，出版书籍和手册，组织会议和论坛。

sentences.english: Books on popular science are selling well.
Second, he pays little attentation to his cloth, food or other enjoyments but spend much money to buy law books.
sentences.chinese: 还有，他不注重衣食住行，而热衷于购买法律书籍。

sentences.english: The essence of bookbinding is its artistry and time spirit.
sentences.chinese: 书籍装帧设计的艺术性和时代感是它的生命。

sentences.english: This book is about water , air and soil pollution.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本介绍水体，大气和土壤污染的书籍。

sentences.english: Second, I want to read some books I like, such as the fiction books.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我想读一些我喜欢的书籍，比如小说书。

sentences.english: You can download free electronic copies of all of his books at this site.
sentences.chinese: 您可以从此站点免费下载他所有书籍的电子版。

sentences.english: This book since 1930's sold over 60 million copies. One of the best sellers in history.
sentences.chinese: 从30年代至今销售超过6千万本，史上最畅销书籍。

sentences.english: In fact, I'm reading a number of books right now on software teams and ways that seem to help form good teams.
sentences.chinese: 随即我开始阅读大量关于软件团队和工作方式的书籍。

sentences.english: RenShi RenShi: What is your favorite movie of all time?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢的书籍电影音乐？

sentences.english: If you can digitize books, go for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能把这些书籍数字化，那么可以。

definition: books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
